name: Kepler-1661
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-1661 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-1661 is a star with 0.84 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.76 times its radius. It is located 1355.24 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-1661 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-1661 system


Kepler-1661 b

Kepler-1661 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.63 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-1661 b is 17.00982 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-1661 b is 3.87 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-1661 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-1661, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
